software.name: HeyTCM Smart TCM Platform
software.description: A smart health management cloud platform integrating TCM theory and modern technology, supporting multi-platform, data analytics, and personalized health services.
featureList: TCM constitution analysis and health advice

openData.title: Open Data: Fueling Research and Innovation
openData.desc: HeyTCM Open Data Platform collects, organizes, and shares high-quality TCM health data for researchers and developers, driving intelligent TCM development. We strictly adhere to privacy protection— all data is anonymized.

items.title: PPG Dataset
items.desc: A vast, continuous collection of PPG data across diverse ages, genders, and body types in various scenarios.

items.title: Disease & Prescription Database
items.desc: Structured TCM diagnosis data, including symptom descriptions, tongue/pulse images, syndrome differentiation, prescriptions, and efficacy tracking.

items.title: Weight Loss Database
items.desc: Comprehensive weight loss data, including weight changes, body fat, physiological indicators, diet records, and mood tracking.

cta.title: Explore More Open Data
cta.desc: Visit HeyTCM Open Data Platform to access more high-quality TCM health data for research and innovation.

openSource.title: Open Source: Building Smart TCM Tools Together
openSource.desc: HeyTCM actively promotes open-source TCM projects. Developers are welcome to contribute code, suggestions, and help improve the intelligent TCM toolchain.

items.title: HeyTCM Open Algorithm Library
items.desc: A collection of TCM algorithms for signal processing, health assessment, and data visualization, deployable across platforms.

items.title: AI Syndrome Differentiation Library
items.desc: A machine-learning-based TCM syndrome differentiation library, supporting multiple sensor inputs and interpretable predictions.

items.title: PPG Signal Analysis Toolkit
items.desc: A lightweight PPG signal processing library for browser and Node.js, offering filtering, feature extraction, and time-frequency analysis.

items.title: TCM Knowledge Graph Framework
items.desc: A structured TCM knowledge graph framework for modeling and reasoning about meridians, organs, formulas, and herbs.

items.title: Become an Open Source Contributor
items.desc: We welcome all forms of contributions—code, documentation, algorithm improvements, bug fixes, or feature suggestions. Whether you’re a seasoned developer or a TCM practitioner, you can join our open-source projects.

cta.title: Join Open Source Co-Creation
cta.desc: Join the HeyTCM open-source community and drive innovation in smart TCM tools with developers worldwide.

community.title: Co-Creation Community: Gathering Diverse Forces
community.desc: The HeyTCM community brings together TCM practitioners, developers, researchers, and health enthusiasts. We regularly host online and offline events to promote knowledge sharing and innovation.

items.title: Online Co-Creation Meetings
items.desc: Regular online meetings to share the latest research and practical experience.

items.title: Fasting Circle
items.desc: A safe and scientific space for fasting practice, sharing experiences, mutual support, and risk reduction. Our members range from seasoned fasters to curious newcomers.

items.title: Shanghan Reading Group
items.desc: Collectively reading TCM classics like Shang Han Lun, reinterpreting ancient wisdom through a modern lens, and tackling challenging sections together every week.

items.title: General Discussion Forum
items.desc: A free space to discuss TCM topics, share personal health management experiences, ask questions, explore product tips, and connect with experts from various fields.

items.title: Contribution Heroes List
items.desc: The vitality of the community comes from the participation and contributions of every member. Whether sharing experience, answering questions, contributing data, or developing features, every effort drives the progress of intelligent TCM.

cta.title: Join HeyTCM Co-Creation Community
cta.desc: Communicate, learn, and co-create the future with TCM enthusiasts, experts, and developers.
